info.headline: Blowing Dust Advisory issued March 18 at 12:47PM MDT until March 18 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Pueblo CO
info.description:
* WHAT...For the High Wind Warning, west winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 55 mph. For the Blowing Dust Advisory, visibility between one-quarter and one mile in blowing dust.
* WHERE...Otero, and Eastern Las Animas.
* WHEN...Until 7 PM MDT this evening.
* IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions due to reduced visibility. Damaging winds may blow down trees and power lines. Widespread power outages are possible. Travel will be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles.
info.instruction:
Persons with respiratory problems should make preparations to stay indoors until the storm passes. Be ready for a sudden drop in visibility to near zero. If you encounter blowing dust or blowing sand on the roadway or see it approaching, pull off the road as far as possible and put your vehicle in park. Turn the lights all the way off and keep foot off the brake pedal. Remember, 'Pull Aside, Stay Alive'.
Remain in the lower levels of your home during the windstorm, and avoid windows. Watch for falling debris and tree limbs. Use caution if you must drive.

parameter.value: HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM MDT THIS EVENING... ...BLOWING DUST ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM MDT THIS EVENING

area.areaDesc: La Junta Vicinity/Otero County; Eastern Las Animas County
